title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Operations Research Analysts

content.rendered:
What is an Operations Research Analyst?

Operations Research Analysts use mathematical and analytical skills to help organizations solve problems and decide the best course of action.

Where does an Operations Research Analyst work?

  • Finance companies
  • Technical businesses
  • Government

How much does an Operations Research Analyst make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Operations Research Analyst is $58,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Operations Research Analyst?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Computer science majors
  • Engineering majors
  • Math majors
  • Physics majors
Search Operations Research Analyst jobs on Handshake

Operations Research Analyst skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Operations Research Analysts succeed in their work:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Mathematics background
  • Good critical thinking skills

What are some common questions about Operations Research Analysts?

Q: How do I become an Operations Research Analyst?

A: Most Operations Research jobs require that you have at minimum a bachelor’s degree in a related field. Depending on the specific role you’re applying for, you might need more experience in the field.
